title: Gaza Cease-Fire Begins, Israel Says, as Thousands Return to the North
summary: The Israeli military’s announcement of a pause in fighting brought a mass movement of people heading home to Gaza City and its surroundings.

title: Aid Groups Prepare to Provide Quick Relief to Gaza Under Cease-Fire
summary: The new Israel-Hamas deal contains provisions to increase aid to Gaza, and for the reopening of a border crossing from Egypt.

title: How Jared Kushner, a Self-Described ‘Deal Guy,’ Helped Broker a Gaza Breakthrough
summary: Trained in New York City real estate, the president’s son-in-law had a single goal: Get to a yes first, and hash out the details later. “It’s just different being deal guys — just a different sport,” he said.

title: How Trump Got Israel and Hamas to a Truce
summary: Israel approved an agreement brokered by President Trump that paves the way for a cease-fire in the war in Gaza and the return of all remaining hostages.

title: The Fiscal Gambit at the Center of the Shutdown
summary: It is a well-worn strategy to temporarily create a government benefit and hope that its eventual expiration will create a standoff like the shutdown fight.

title: Under Trump, E.P.A. Explored if Abortion Pills Could Be Detected in Wastewater
summary: Scientists at the Environmental Protection Agency found that they could develop methods to identify traces of the medication if necessary — a practice long sought by the anti-abortion movement.

title: What a National Guard Deployment Means
summary: John Ismay, who reports on the Pentagon for The New York Times, describes what National Guard troops and civilian law enforcement are doing in cities where President Trump has mobilized them.

title: M.I.T. Rejects a White House Offer for Special Funding Treatment
summary: The Trump administration offered nine universities benefits in exchange for signing an agreement to protect conservative voices, among other things. M.I.T. was the first to refuse.

title: Judge Rejects ‘Unprecedented’ Indictment Amid Trump’s D.C. Clampdown
summary: The federal magistrate judge, Zia M. Faruqui, accused prosecutors of relying on a “facially invalid” indictment to charge a man with felony gun possession.

title: Trump Moves to Cancel Esmeralda 7, a Giant Solar Project
summary: Known as Esmeralda 7, the project planned in the Nevada desert would have produced enough energy to power nearly two million homes.

title: Glenn Close on ‘Sunset Boulevard,’ ‘Fatal Attraction’ and Her Storied Career
summary: For half a century, she’s brought her singular talents to the stage and screen. Now, the actress wants one more shot at the role that helped make her a star.

title: Deaths Are Reported in Explosion at Tennessee Munitions Plant
summary: A number of people were missing after a “devastating blast” at Accurate Energetic Systems, about 60 miles southwest of Nashville, a county sheriff said.

title: James Indictment Mirrors Her Civil Case Against Trump in Miniature
summary: The president and New York’s attorney general accused each other of real estate fraud. But the sum involved in her case is $18,933, while millions were at stake in his.

title: Iran Lures Transgender Foreigners for Surgery but Forces Operations on Locals
summary: Iran became a pioneer in gender transition operations by forcing procedures on L.G.B.T.Q. Iranians. Desperate for cash, the Islamic republic is hoping to attract trans patients from around the world.

title: Why China Built 162 Square Miles of Solar Panels on the World’s Highest Plateau
summary: China is using the high-altitude expanse for immense solar panel farms and wind turbines and has begun work on the world’s largest hydroelectric dams.

title: This Family’s Home Has Stood for a Century — in Four Different Countries
summary: As armies and revolutions came and went, neighbors became foes and families spoke different languages. Here’s how one small town stood at the center of history.

title: John Lodge, Moody Blues Singer and Bassist, Dies at 82
summary: He wrote some of the band’s signature songs, including “Ride My See-Saw” and “I’m Just a Singer (in a Rock and Roll Band).”

title: Curious Reindeer and Charging Polar Bears: The Changing Wildlife at the Top of the Earth
summary: Climate change is transforming ecosystems in the far north. An international team of scientists has made some surprising discoveries.

title: James Comey. Letitia James. Who’s Next?
summary: America is now in a dangerous period, in which the president can order investigations and indictments against his enemies.

title: The A.I. Prompt That Could End the World
summary: A destructive A.I., like a nuclear bomb, is now a concrete possibility; the question is whether anyone will be reckless enough to build one.

title: A Cease-Fire Begins
summary: We explain the latest on the deal between Israel and Hamas.

title: France’s Domestic Instability Has Weakened Its Diplomatic Clout
summary: President Emmanuel Macron’s inability to find a government that can pass a new budget is hobbling his efforts to influence Europe’s agenda.

title: Mexico’s President Is Popular. So Is Her Professional Lookalike.
summary: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico’s first woman president, has recent approval ratings as high as 79 percent. An actress with a startling resemblance, Tamara Henaine, is taking advantage of the moment.

title: David Del Rio Leaves ‘Matlock’ After CBS Investigation
summary: David Del Rio portrayed a young lawyer on one of television’s most popular shows.

title: Bats Catch Migratory Birds and Eat Them in Midair
summary: For the first time, scientists documented direct evidence of a bat preying on a bird at high altitude.
